generalfeedback.text:
We are asked to integrate the function \(f(x,y) = x^3 + x y^2\) over the quadrant \(x \ge 0\), \(y \ge 0\), \(x^2 + y^2 \le 1\).

The quadrant is shown below

[[jsxgraph]] var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { // STACK: when moving to STACK change 'jxgboard' for divid boundingbox: [-0.5, 1.5, 1.5, -0.5], keepaspectratio: true, axis: true, showCopyright: false, showNavigation: false, grid: false }); // Create quadrant var p1 = board.create('point', [0,0], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: false}); var p2 = board.create('point', [0,1], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: false}); var p3 = board.create('point', [1,0], {fixed: true, withLabel:false, visible: false}); var quadrant = board.create('minorsector', [p1, p2, p3]); [[/jsxgraph]]

Since the region of integration is the quarter of the unit circle in the first quadrant, it makes sense to use polar coordinates.

So, we have \(0 \le r \le 1\), and \(0 \le \theta \le \dfrac{\pi}{2}\), and therefore the integral may be written (remembering that \(x = r\cos \theta\) and \(y = r \sin \theta\)),

\(\begin{align} \qquad \displaystyle I &= \int_{0}^{\frac{\pi}{2}} \int_{0}^{1} \left[(r\cos\theta)^3 + r\cos\theta \times (r\sin\theta)^2 \right] \, r\, \mathrm{d}r\, \mathrm{d}\theta \\ &= \int_{0}^{\frac{\pi}{2}} \int_{0}^{1} r^4\cos\theta \left(\cos^2\theta + \sin^2\theta\right) \, \mathrm{d}r\, \mathrm{d}\theta\\ &= \int_{0}^{\frac{\pi}{2}} \int_{0}^{1} r^4\cos\theta \, \mathrm{d}r\, \mathrm{d}\theta \end{align}\)

Which can be rewritten as

\(\begin{align} \qquad \displaystyle I &= \int_{0}^{\frac{\pi}{2}} \cos\theta \, \mathrm{d}\theta \times \int_{0}^{1} r^4 \mathrm{d}r \\ &= \left[\sin\theta\right]_{0}^{\frac{\pi}{2}} \times \left[\dfrac{1}{5} r^5\right]_{0}^{1} \\ &= \left(\sin\dfrac{\pi}{2} - \sin0\right) \times \left(\dfrac{1}{5}(1)^5 - 0\right) \\ &= 1 \times \dfrac{1}{5} \\ &= \dfrac{1}{5}. \end{align}\)
